How to Install funnelweb on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • funnelweb

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install funnelweb on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing funnelweb on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall funnelweb in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install funnelweb, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install funnelweb Using apt

To install funnelweb in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install funnelweb using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install funnelweb

The installation of funnelweb might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install funnelweb Using apt-get

To install funnelweb using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install funnelweb.

sudo apt-get -y install funnelweb

Install funnelweb Using Synaptic

To install funnelweb using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install funnelweb on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for funnelweb. This will display the funnelweb package in the package window, now to install funnelweb, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the funnelweb package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of funnelweb.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install funnelweb Using aptitude

To install funnelweb on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of funnelweb.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install funnelweb using the command aptitude install funnelweb.

sudo aptitude -y install funnelweb

How to Upgrade funnelweb on debian

If you want to upgrade the funnelweb package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade funnelweb using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade funnelweb to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade funnelweb.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade funnelweb sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade funnelweb

Upgrade funnelweb using Aptitude

To upgrade funnelweb using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade funnelweb.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade funnelweb

Upgrade funnelweb using Synaptic

To upgrade funnelweb using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for funnelweb, now right-click funnelweb, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade funnelweb just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall funnelweb on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall funnelweb from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just funnelweb, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove funnelweb

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of funnelweb

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of funnelweb you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge funnelweb

Remove funnelweb using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall funnelweb using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for funnelweb, right-click the funnelweb package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall funnelweb click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install funnelweb on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade funnelweb using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.

If you need any help regarding the installation of funnelweb then send me a mail at netmikoblog@gmail.com, thank you.
